Front End Developer

Company Name Levo Digital Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 136 views

Job description

Experienced Front End Developer
Sydney or Melbourne


LEVO is a leading specialist CMS and eCommerce digital delivery consultancy. We assist organisations realise the potential of their technology assets by connecting people with the things they want and need, when and where they need them. We combine intelligent user experience and design with a deep-rooted understanding of technology and business systems to empower organisations to better connect and communicate with their audiences.


Due to a period of high growth we are seeking an experienced Front End Developer. Our ideal candidate will be obsessive over great work, love working with a variety of people, be self-motivated, passionate and proactive, and have the ability to take constructive criticism on board and find solutions to problems. You should be familiar with the full software design life cycle and have experience in designing, coding, testing and consistently managing applications. You should also be comfortable coding in a number of languages and have an ability to test code in order to maintain high-quality code.


You'll have to be intimately familiar with HTML/CSS and the latest standards, you'll have good JS skills, and be well versed in getting around cross-browser compatibility issues.


Responsibilities


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Coding, testing and deployment of front end assets for websites across multiple systems/platforms.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Development in across a number of leading front-end technologies

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Implement website functionality and page/content templates for the EPiserver and Sitecore CMS

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Collaborate with internal and external team members

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Follow outlined standards of quality related to code and systems

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Develop automated tests and conduct performance tuning


Experience


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 EPiServer or Sitecore CMS

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Strong HTML/CSS (LESS)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Strong JS, bonus points for frameworks (React, Angular)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Git

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 NPM/Gulp/Grunt/Webpack

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap, SASS, PostCSS, AutoPrefixer

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience with RESTful APIs

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Agile methodologies and JIRA

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Angular JS and front skills (preferred but not essential)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proven ability to understand and transfer business requirements into viable technical solutions

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience working in agile development environment


Qualifications


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant field

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 4+ years of experience working with HTML, CSS, JS or relevant experiences


Contacts

Cale Maxwell, Chief Operating Officer
e: calemaxwell@levo.com.au m: 0402 625 022

Craig Roberts, Director

e. craigroberts@levo.com.au m: 0414 544 744

About LEVO


LEVO assists organisations to realise the potential of their technology assets by connecting people with the things they want and need, when and where they need them. Established in 2005, LEVO has offices across Australia and New Zealand along with an established global network providing round the clock capability and support. Combining intelligent user experience and design with a deep-rooted understanding of technology and business systems, LEVO empowers organisations to better connect and communicate with their audiences.

\xa0

We are a team of 60+ technologists working across verticals including experience and product design, eCommerce, CMS, CRM and custom application development. With a renowned ability to execute, LEVO delivers unprecedented value through our innovative delivery approach.

[

Associate Game Designer

Company Name Electronic Arts (EA) Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Studio

Electronic Arts’ Firemonkeys Studio in Melbourne, Australia is regarded throughout the industry as a leader in delivering high quality, engaging games on iOS and Android. We regularly release substantial updates for our acclaimed live mobile titles, including Real Racing 3, The Sims FreePlay and Need for Speed: No Limits.

The Role

We’re looking for a highly talented and dedicated Game Designer who thrives in fast-paced, ever-changing development and live service environments. As a Game Designer you’ll be an integral member of the team, shaping our games to satisfy both dedicated and casual players, driving commercial success on a free-to-play business model.

Your Responsibilities Will Include
  • Developing and refining content to maintain our successful live service roadmap.
  • Working within existing systems, plan and implement economy and gameplay tuning, including collecting and integrating player feedback
  • Working with the Lead Designer to define and drive the design with regards to the live events roadmap, story, characters, quest writing and more.
  • Working closely with the Lead Designer to ensure at all stages design goals are met.
  • Identifying and implementing improvements to workflow and tools.
  • Establishing, maintaining and enhancing relationships with the development team.
  • Participating in design discussions & getting buy-in from the team
  • Being an advocate for the player and the player experience

You Will Have
  • Proven success as a game designer and/or have shipped a game.
  • Experience with scheduling and prioritising design tasks.
  • Experience with narrative design games is desirable.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong documentation skills.
  • Experience with designing successful free-to-play mobile games highly desirable.
  • Experience with the MS Office suite highly desirable, specifically Excel.
  • Great attention to detail.

The Perks
  • Brand new studio, located next to Southern Cross Station.
  • Subsidised health care programme and gym allowance.
  • Excellent employee benefits, bonuses and share options.
  • Subsidised games and consoles, with additional games available to take home to play.
  • Fully stocked kitchen for breakfast, lunch, fresh fruit and hot drinks.
  • Friday night socials and regular team building outings.
Please provide a portfolio including game design documentation and other examples of your design work.

Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.

Industry

  • Computer Games
  • Information Technology and Services
  • Computer Software

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Art/Creative
  • Design
  • Engineering

Joint Venture & Fund Reporting Analyst - Group Property Insights

Company Name Vicinity Centres Company Location Chadstone, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 175 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At the heart of who we are is our purpose of enriching community experiences. It’s what unites us, and what drives us.
And when we talk community, we are talking about all our communities; our retailers, consumers, investors, partners and our people. All are important to us, and we value them greatly.\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

\xa0

Our vision in Finance is to drive growth through insights and recommendations. This is achieved by utilising skills, solutions and recommendations aligned to strategy and taking analytics to recommend and drive outcomes.


\xa0Role Purpose

\xa0

The key purpose of the role of Analyst - JV & Fund Reporting is to act as a conduit between JV Partners and Vicinity Departments to resolve issues and queries in a timely and effective manner. You are responsible for monitoring, reviewing and reporting business performance on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis for JV partner assets as well as identifying and implementing efficiencies for reporting. \xa0\xa0


The role is key in providing advice to internal departments within Vicinity and preparing and co-ordinating responses to ad-hoc queries.



What will you bring?

\xa0

You will bring extensive experience in management accounting, analysis and budgeting with outstanding commercial acumen. You will have an analytical mind with a keen eye for detail, high level of numeracy and analysis capability, problem solving skills, a desire for relentless curiosity and an ability to co-ordinate processes and set/achieve deadlines. Your strong interpersonal skills will enable you to build relationships across wide range of stakeholders. You will have tertiary qualifications in Accounting or Finance and be CPA/CA qualified.

\xa0


What will success look like?

\xa0

We Imagine a Better Way

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You enjoy challenges and new responsibilities and are willing to try new ideas and apply the learnings to improve business outcomes.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You have outstanding influencing and stakeholder management skills.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0You are a strategic thinker who takes action to seek out best practice.


We Embrace Difference

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You are always adaptable in your approach and responsive to the needs of the key stakeholders and leaders you support.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You consistently demonstrate a willingness to listen and understand new ideas to drive process improvement.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You are resilient and adopt a growth mindset in everything you do.


We Always Collaborate

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You facilitate knowledge sharing across teams, connecting team members and sharing best practice.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You enjoy taking time to advise and help develop the capability and skills of others

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 You proactively consult, engage and listen to all team members and make sound decisions in a transparent manner.

\xa0


Why Vicinity?


At Vicinity, we are in the business of people. The people who shop in our centres, lease our retail space, invest in our centres, and of course, the people who work in and for our centres and our corporate office. Our people are important, and we believe in giving them every opportunity to grow and succeed in our business. Our benefits program focuses on creating an awesome place to work in which our people are rewarded and recognised, and offers flexibility, balance and continuous learning opportunities, ensuring we give back, and that we look after ourselves.

Our values cultivate a culture that encourages our 1300+ team members to be curious, agile, passionate and committed. At Vicinity we embrace difference. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that supports diversity and flexibility.


Note: To be eligible to apply for this position, you must have existing, relevant Australian work rights. At the later stages of the recruitment process the shortlisted candidate/candidates will be required to undergo a Criminal History Background/Police Check as a mandatory part of the process. Additional qualification checks may also be required dependant on role and level.

815888967:
[

Agronomist

Company Name CSBP Fertilisers Company Location Victoria, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 108 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



JOB REF FER321148

  • Are you passionate about agriculture, science and innovation?
  • Are you inspired to make a difference in agriculture?
  • Permanent / Full Time / Flexible opportunity based in regional Victoria

Agriculture has come a long way over the past 100 years and CSBP has been there every step of the way. CSBP Soil and Plant Analysis Laboratory has served the Australian agricultural industry for almost half a century enabling our customers to better understand, manage and optimise nutrient use.

Part of Wesfarmers Chemicals, Energy & Fertilisers, CSBP Lab is Australia’s preferred service partner for agricultural analysis. We support informed decisions through agricultural analysis services that are facts-based, fast and fit for purpose.

The role

Based in regional Victoria, you will support and grow sales of CSBP Lab products and services across Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland and South Australia.

Working with our Ag Tech partner Decipher and the CSBP field research and services teams in Western Australia, you will provide support and advice on CSBP Lab products and services and on the use of enabling and supplementary products, services and activities. You will also provide agronomy support on soil and plant nutrition.

You will collaborate with our customers and other stakeholders, including agronomists, consultants, researchers, growers and retailers, building, and fostering industry relationships to increase knowledge, influence industry developments and grow business.

Keeping abreast of market trends and nutritional concepts, you will capture and create opportunities and better agricultural outcomes through products and services innovation.

The person

You are a passionate and engaging agricultural scientist who collaborates with others, is self-directed and enjoys working autonomously. You are also keen to contribute to business growth and agricultural knowledge. In addition you will have

  • Demonstrated experience working with agricultural companies and/or researchers
  • Knowledge of agricultural systems, in particular soil and plant nutrition
  • Highly-developed interpersonal and communication skills
  • Sound analytical, commercial and planning skills

We welcome people with different skills, and life experiences and encourage individuals from diverse backgrounds to apply.

We pride ourselves on developing and supporting people and recognise the importance of flexibility. When you apply, please let us know if you are seeking a flexible employment arrangement.

Applications close 5pm, Monday 3 September 2018

We reserve the right to commence the recruitment process prior to the closing date. It is recommended to apply as soon as possible.

Industry

  • Computer Software
  • Staffing and Recruiting

Full-time

  • Analyst
  • Information Technology

[

Identity AND Access Management Technical Specialist

Company Name The Decipher Bureau Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 121 views

Job description

My client is a growing Cyber Security practice with a very strong reputation in Identity and Access management. Their team has a large team of technical specialists and leaders who are able to provide Identity solutions to a range of clients both large and small.

\xa0

As part of their continued growth in the ever-increasing Identity market landscape, they have a need for technical specialists who can work to deliver new projects across key technology areas. Ideally you will come from a development / programming background with recent experience using IAM technologies.

\xa0

Role:

\xa0

As a technical member of the Identity team you will:

\xa0

  • Plan and provide reviews and guidance for IAM tasks and engagements
  • Participate in the design and delivery of cloud based IAM solutions
  • Provide technical skills and knowledge in the implementation of IAM solutions using products such as, ForgeRock, Oracle IAM, Sailpoint IIQ, OKTA.
  • Design and build product customization and plugins
  • Demonstrate strong Platform / Technology knowledge, especially pertaining to IAM
  • Identify and perform non-functional test requirements
  • Manage and mentor less experienced team members during the delivery of an engagement
  • Assist with IAM problem analysis and resolution

\xa0

About You:

\xa0

  • You will have experience in information systems development and delivery preferably including integration and or security applications and products.
  • At least three of these years of experience integrating identity management, access management and access governance software into clients' infrastructure and applications.
  • Three or more years’ experience with installation, integration and deployment of one or more of the following IAM products: Sailpoint, Oracle, CyberArk, ForgeRock, Okta, Gigya, CA, Sun, IBM and Ping in a client environment
  • Identity and Access Management familiarity in at least two of the following areas: Single Sign On Access management Identity Federation Enterprise Directory Resource Provisioning Lifecycle management Identity & Access Governance\xa0
  • At least two years’ experience with the following programming languages: Java, JavaScript, JSP/Servlets, SQL is preferable
  • Three years plus experience within projects through the full system development lifecycle
  • BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Engineering, Information Technology, Finance, Business, Math, etc.
